intro: Pelexia chironiana, commonly known as the red-flowered pelexia, is a striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, bright red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a fern-like appearance, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Pelexia chironiana is native to parts of Europe and is often cultivated for its attractive floral display.
